name: GPT-Replit - ChatGPT in your Repl.
description: A little ChatGPT in your Replit editor that can view your files (if you want).
longDescription:
# Replit-GPT

A little ChatGPT in your Replit editor. If you open files with GPT-replit, the file contents will be passed to the AI so you can ask questions about it.

## Usage:
Open GPT-Replit in a pane and press the + button, now a pop-up should open. Choose the file(s) you want the AI to know. Now you can ask questions about the code in the file(s). Press the microphone to use your voice to ask questions. The gear icon can be pressed to customize the response. And when the right model is selected  you can upload images to the conversation

scopes.name: read
scopes.reason: This permission is needed to read the files you have selected.

features.title: Open files
features.body: You can open multiple files for the AI to view. This way you can ask the AI about your code and it can accurately respond. Drag the file(s) onto the trash button or just press the delete button on it to remove the AI from accessing it.

features.title: Chat with GPT using different models.
features.body: You can choose with which models you want to talk to. We have some preset, `GPT-4o`, `GPT-4 Turbo`, `GPT-4`, `GPT-4 32K` and `GPT-3.5 Turbo`, but you can enter other models.

features.title: Analyse images
features.body: You can upload images to the AI which the AI can analyze, you can use this to make your request more clear or can be used for a lot of other things. It compresses the uploaded image so that the request will not cost as much. It is also possible to use local images on the repl you are, in by starting your URl with `replit://`. Example: `replit://image.png`.

features.title: "No yap" mode
features.body: In the settings, you can enable an option to "quit yapping," ensuring the AI provides straightforward answers in every conversation.
